[Teacher]: them.  This passage contains several interesting elements, including the tone, the narrator's relationship with animals, and the narrative's themes.  One of the main elements that stands out is the narrator's fascination with animals. He is described as being "more interested in the animals than we are of your own age or on the outskirts of town." This suggests that the narrator has a unique and perhaps isolated perspective on life, where animals play a significant role in his experiences and thoughts.  The narrator's relationship with animals

STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: You mean the whole place is so much fun
[Teacher]: , they'd throw a party for you! That's what happened to me when my family found out I was adopted. They threw me a party like I was a new baby or something. I was 12. It was hilarious. We even made a cake with candles that said "Welcome Home." It was a really special day.  As for me, I don't really celebrate any holidays with my family. My parents are from different cultures, and I'm not really tied to any particular tradition.
[Student]: But in fact I want you to do just as you can at home on Saturdays and even Thanksgivings when it isnt really Thanksgiving time yet because I think my parents would love to have kids together before we all start up again and be happy about it and enjoy everything else until were sure we get older and come closer to getting used to the same things happen every week of Christmas Day or after weve had our Christmas break whenever we started going into church and walking around looking back at them through
[Teacher]: the windows and I dont know if that ever happens with you but in my family. We'd have a big Christmas dinner, and my dad would always try to convince my mom to let him wear his fancy suit to church. She would always say no, but he would keep trying. It was funny. In the holiday season, we would also have a big tree decorated with lights, and my sister and I would fight over who got to put the star on top. It was a silly tradition,

the windows and I dont know if that ever happens with you but in my family. We'd have a big Christmas dinner, and my dad would always try to convince my mom to let him wear his fancy suit to church. She would always say no, but he would keep trying. It was funny. In the holiday season, we would also have a big tree decorated with lights, and my sister and I would fight over who got to put the star on top. It was a silly tradition,
